docs.snippet: Coach Roy Hodgson should pump fresh blood into his already eliminated England team for their final World Cup game against Costa Rica on Tuesday to prepare for future competitions, former England coach Glenn Hoddle said on Monday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Coach Roy Hodgson should pump fresh blood into his already eliminated England team for their final World Cup game against Costa Rica on Tuesday to prepare for future competitions, former England coach Glenn Hoddle said on Monday.

headline.main: Pump New Blood Into Team for Finale-Hoddle Tells England
headline.print_headline: Pump New Blood Into Team for Finale-Hoddle Tells England

docs.snippet: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez smiled and shrugged off any lingering concerns about his surgically repaired left knee, declaring Monday it was in "perfect shape" the day before a match against Italy that Uruguay must win to advance beyond the group...
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay striker Luis Suarez smiled and shrugged off any lingering concerns about his surgically repaired left knee, declaring Monday it was in "perfect shape" the day before a match against Italy that Uruguay must win to advance beyond the group stage at the World Cup.

headline.main: Suarez Says Knee 'Perfect' Before Italy Match
headline.print_headline: Suarez Says Knee 'Perfect' Before Italy Match

docs.snippet: Felled by an opponent's knee to the head as they both chased the ball, a player is seemingly out cold on a World Cup pitch. The clock is ticking. Millions are watching. National honor, careers and sponsorship dollars are at stake.
docs.lead_paragraph: Felled by an opponent's knee to the head as they both chased the ball, a player is seemingly out cold on a World Cup pitch. The clock is ticking. Millions are watching. National honor, careers and sponsorship dollars are at stake.

headline.main: World Cup Focuses Minds on Concussion Management
headline.print_headline: World Cup Focuses Minds on Concussion Management

docs.snippet: Brazil's poster-boy striker Neymar fulfilled a nation's expectations to score twice in a 4-1 destruction of Cameroon on Monday while the Netherlands again showed their potential to win the World Cup with a third straight win.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil's poster-boy striker Neymar fulfilled a nation's expectations to score twice in a 4-1 destruction of Cameroon on Monday while the Netherlands again showed their potential to win the World Cup with a third straight win.

headline.main: Neymar Inspires Brazil, Dutch Storm On at World Cup
headline.print_headline: Neymar Inspires Brazil, Dutch Storm On at World Cup

docs.snippet: Brazil relied on its star Neymar for two early goals to beat Cameroon 4-1 Monday and reach the World Cup's knockout stage for a South American showdown against Chile, a 2-0 loser to the Netherlands.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brazil relied on its star Neymar for two early goals to beat Cameroon 4-1 Monday and reach the World Cup's knockout stage for a South American showdown against Chile, a 2-0 loser to the Netherlands.

headline.main: Neymar Leads Brazil; Mexico Also Through
headline.print_headline: Neymar Leads Brazil; Mexico Also Through

docs.snippet: After 12 days of competition, Colombia has already achieved more than it could ever have imagined at the World Cup in Brazil.

docs.snippet: The arrival in Brazil of more than 200,000 fans from Latin America exemplifies one of the region’s most profound shifts: the rise of the middle class.
docs.lead_paragraph: The arrival in Brazil of more than 200,000 fans from Latin America exemplifies one of the region’s most profound shifts: the rise of the middle class.
docs.abstract: Arrival in Brazil of more than 200,000 Spanish-speaking soccer fans from nearby countries for the World Cup illustrates rise of middle class in Latin America; middle class in Latin America has grown 60.3 percent since 2003.

headline.seo: World Cup Displays a Region’s Old Passions and Its New Wealth
headline.main: A Win for Latin America’s Middle Class
headline.print_headline: A Win for Latin America’s Middle Class

byline.contributor: Lucy Jordan contributed reporting from Brasília, and Jonathan Gilbert from Rio de Janeiro.
